  343 peter@eisentraut.org     2493                 :CBC         917 : }
                               2494                 :                : 
                               2495                 :                : /*
                               2496                 :                :  *  makeObjectName()
                               2497                 :                :  *
                               2498                 :                :  *  Create a name for an implicitly created index, sequence, constraint,
                               2499                 :                :  *  extended statistics, etc.
                               2500                 :                :  *
                               2501                 :                :  *  The parameters are typically: the original table name, the original field
                               2502                 :                :  *  name, and a "type" string (such as "seq" or "pkey").    The field name
                               2503                 :                :  *  and/or type can be NULL if not relevant.
                               2504                 :                :  *
                               2505                 :                :  *  The result is a palloc'd string.
                               2506                 :                :  *
                               2507                 :                :  *  The basic result we want is "name1_name2_label", omitting "_name2" or
                               2508                 :                :  *  "_label" when those parameters are NULL.  However, we must generate
                               2509                 :                :  *  a name with less than NAMEDATALEN characters!  So, we truncate one or
                               2510                 :                :  *  both names if necessary to make a short-enough string.  The label part
                               2511                 :                :  *  is never truncated (so it had better be reasonably short).
                               2512                 :                :  *
                               2513                 :                :  *  The caller is responsible for checking uniqueness of the generated
                               2514                 :                :  *  name and retrying as needed; retrying will be done by altering the
                               2515                 :                :  *  "label" string (which is why we never truncate that part).
                               2516                 :                :  */
                               2517                 :                : char *
 7747 tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us        2518                 :          54882 : makeObjectName(const char *name1, const char *name2, const char *label)
                               2519                 :                : {
                               2520                 :                :     char       *name;
                               2521                 :          54882 :     int         overhead = 0;   /* chars needed for label and underscores */
                               2522                 :                :     int         availchars;     /* chars available for name(s) */
                               2523                 :                :     int         name1chars;     /* chars allocated to name1 */
                               2524                 :                :     int         name2chars;     /* chars allocated to name2 */
                               2525                 :                :     int         ndx;
                               2526                 :                : 
                               2527                 :          54882 :     name1chars = strlen(name1);
                               2528         [ +  + ]:          54882 :     if (name2)
                               2529                 :                :     {
                               2530                 :          48092 :         name2chars = strlen(name2);
                               2531                 :          48092 :         overhead++;             /* allow for separating underscore */
                               2532                 :                :     }
                               2533                 :                :     else
                               2534                 :           6790 :         name2chars = 0;
                               2535         [ +  + ]:          54882 :     if (label)
                               2536                 :          21503 :         overhead += strlen(label) + 1;
                               2537                 :                : 
                               2538                 :          54882 :     availchars = NAMEDATALEN - 1 - overhead;
                               2539         [ -  + ]:          54882 :     Assert(availchars > 0);      /* else caller chose a bad label */
                               2540                 :                : 
                               2541                 :                :     /*
                               2542                 :                :      * If we must truncate, preferentially truncate the longer name. This
                               2543                 :                :      * logic could be expressed without a loop, but it's simple and obvious as
                               2544                 :                :      * a loop.
                               2545                 :                :      */
                               2546         [ +  + ]:          54915 :     while (name1chars + name2chars > availchars)
                               2547                 :                :     {
                               2548         [ -  + ]:             33 :         if (name1chars > name2chars)
 7747 tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us        2549                 :UBC           0 :             name1chars--;
                               2550                 :                :         else
 7747 tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us        2551                 :CBC          33 :             name2chars--;
                               2552                 :                :     }
                               2553                 :                : 
 7371 neilc@samurai.com        2554                 :          54882 :     name1chars = pg_mbcliplen(name1, name1chars, name1chars);
 7747 tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us        2555         [ +  + ]:          54882 :     if (name2)
                               2556                 :          48092 :         name2chars = pg_mbcliplen(name2, name2chars, name2chars);
                               2557                 :                : 
                               2558                 :                :     /* Now construct the string using the chosen lengths */
                               2559                 :          54882 :     name = palloc(name1chars + name2chars + overhead + 1);
                               2560                 :          54882 :     memcpy(name, name1, name1chars);
                               2561                 :          54882 :     ndx = name1chars;
                               2562         [ +  + ]:          54882 :     if (name2)
                               2563                 :                :     {
                               2564                 :          48092 :         name[ndx++] = '_';
                               2565                 :          48092 :         memcpy(name + ndx, name2, name2chars);
                               2566                 :          48092 :         ndx += name2chars;
                               2567                 :                :     }
                               2568         [ +  + ]:          54882 :     if (label)
                               2569                 :                :     {
                               2570                 :          21503 :         name[ndx++] = '_';
                               2571                 :          21503 :         strcpy(name + ndx, label);
                               2572                 :                :     }
                               2573                 :                :     else
                               2574                 :          33379 :         name[ndx] = '\0';
                               2575                 :                : 
                               2576                 :          54882 :     return name;
                               2577                 :                : }
                               2578                 :                : 
                               2579                 :                : /*
                               2580                 :                :  * Select a nonconflicting name for a new relation.  This is ordinarily
                               2581                 :                :  * used to choose index names (which is why it's here) but it can also
                               2582                 :                :  * be used for sequences, or any autogenerated relation kind.
                               2583                 :                :  *
                               2584                 :                :  * name1, name2, and label are used the same way as for makeObjectName(),
                               2585                 :                :  * except that the label can't be NULL; digits will be appended to the label
                               2586                 :                :  * if needed to create a name that is unique within the specified namespace.
                               2587                 :                :  *
                               2588                 :                :  * If isconstraint is true, we also avoid choosing a name matching any
                               2589                 :                :  * existing constraint in the same namespace.  (This is stricter than what
                               2590                 :                :  * Postgres itself requires, but the SQL standard says that constraint names
                               2591                 :                :  * should be unique within schemas, so we follow that for autogenerated
                               2592                 :                :  * constraint names.)
                               2593                 :                :  *
                               2594                 :                :  * Note: it is theoretically possible to get a collision anyway, if someone
                               2595                 :                :  * else chooses the same name concurrently.  We shorten the race condition
                               2596                 :                :  * window by checking for conflicting relations using SnapshotDirty, but
                               2597                 :                :  * that doesn't close the window entirely.  This is fairly unlikely to be
                               2598                 :                :  * a problem in practice, especially if one is holding an exclusive lock on
                               2599                 :                :  * the relation identified by name1.  However, if choosing multiple names
                               2600                 :                :  * within a single command, you'd better create the new object and do
                               2601                 :                :  * CommandCounterIncrement before choosing the next one!
                               2602                 :                :  *
                               2603                 :                :  * Returns a palloc'd string.
                               2604                 :                :  */
                               2605                 :                : char *
                               2606                 :           6753 : ChooseRelationName(const char *name1, const char *name2,
                               2607                 :                :                    const char *label, Oid namespaceid,
                               2608                 :                :                    bool isconstraint)
                               2609                 :                : {
                               2610                 :           6753 :     int         pass = 0;
                               2611                 :           6753 :     char       *relname = NULL;
                               2612                 :                :     char        modlabel[NAMEDATALEN];
                               2613                 :                :     SnapshotData SnapshotDirty;
                               2614                 :                :     Relation    pgclassrel;
                               2615                 :                : 
                               2616                 :                :     /* prepare to search pg_class with a dirty snapshot */
   67                          2617                 :           6753 :     InitDirtySnapshot(SnapshotDirty);
                               2618                 :           6753 :     pgclassrel = table_open(RelationRelationId, AccessShareLock);
                               2619                 :                : 
                               2620                 :                :     /* try the unmodified label first */
 1842 peter@eisentraut.org     2621                 :           6753 :     strlcpy(modlabel, label, sizeof(modlabel));
                               2622                 :                : 
                               2623                 :                :     for (;;)
 7783 tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us        2624                 :            543 :     {
                               2625                 :                :         ScanKeyData key[2];
                               2626                 :                :         SysScanDesc scan;
                               2627                 :                :         bool        collides;
                               2628                 :                : 
 7747                          2629                 :           7296 :         relname = makeObjectName(name1, name2, modlabel);
                               2630                 :                : 
                               2631                 :                :         /* is there any conflicting relation name? */
   67                          2632                 :           7296 :         ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
                               2633                 :                :                     Anum_pg_class_relname,
                               2634                 :                :                     BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_NAMEEQ,
                               2635                 :                :                     CStringGetDatum(relname));
                               2636                 :           7296 :         ScanKeyInit(&key[1],
                               2637                 :                :                     Anum_pg_class_relnamespace,
                               2638                 :                :                     BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
                               2639                 :                :                     ObjectIdGetDatum(namespaceid));
                               2640                 :                : 
                               2641                 :           7296 :         scan = systable_beginscan(pgclassrel, ClassNameNspIndexId,
                               2642                 :                :                                   true /* indexOK */ ,
                               2643                 :                :                                   &SnapshotDirty,
                               2644                 :                :                                   2, key);
                               2645                 :                : 
                               2646                 :           7296 :         collides = HeapTupleIsValid(systable_getnext(scan));
                               2647                 :                : 
                               2648                 :           7296 :         systable_endscan(scan);
                               2649                 :                : 
                               2650                 :                :         /* break out of loop if no conflict */
                               2651         [ +  + ]:           7296 :         if (!collides)
                               2652                 :                :         {
 2548                          2653         [ +  + ]:           6756 :             if (!isconstraint ||
                               2654         [ +  + ]:           4331 :                 !ConstraintNameExists(relname, namespaceid))
                               2655                 :                :                 break;
                               2656                 :                :         }
                               2657                 :                : 
                               2658                 :                :         /* found a conflict, so try a new name component */
 7747                          2659                 :            543 :         pfree(relname);
                               2660                 :            543 :         snprintf(modlabel, sizeof(modlabel), "%s%d", label, ++pass);
                               2661                 :                :     }
                               2662                 :                : 
   67                          2663                 :           6753 :     table_close(pgclassrel, AccessShareLock);
                               2664                 :                : 
 7747                          2665                 :           6753 :     return relname;
                               2666                 :                : }
                               2667                 :                : 
                               2668                 :                : /*
                               2669                 :                :  * Select the name to be used for an index.
                               2670                 :                :  *
                               2671                 :                :  * The argument list is pretty ad-hoc :-(
                               2672                 :                :  */
                               2673                 :                : static char *
 5725                          2674                 :           5624 : ChooseIndexName(const char *tabname, Oid namespaceId,
                               2675                 :                :                 const List *colnames, const List *exclusionOpNames,
                               2676                 :                :                 bool primary, bool isconstraint)
                               2677                 :                : {
                               2678                 :                :     char       *indexname;
                               2679                 :                : 
                               2680         [ +  + ]:           5624 :     if (primary)
                               2681                 :                :     {
                               2682                 :                :         /* the primary key's name does not depend on the specific column(s) */
                               2683                 :           3855 :         indexname = ChooseRelationName(tabname,
                               2684                 :                :                                        NULL,
                               2685                 :                :                                        "pkey",
                               2686                 :                :                                        namespaceId,
                               2687                 :                :                                        true);
                               2688                 :                :     }
                               2689         [ +  + ]:           1769 :     else if (exclusionOpNames != NIL)
                               2690                 :                :     {
                               2691                 :            103 :         indexname = ChooseRelationName(tabname,
                               2692                 :            103 :                                        ChooseIndexNameAddition(colnames),
                               2693                 :                :                                        "excl",
                               2694                 :                :                                        namespaceId,
                               2695                 :                :                                        true);
                               2696                 :                :     }
                               2697         [ +  + ]:           1666 :     else if (isconstraint)
                               2698                 :                :     {
                               2699                 :            370 :         indexname = ChooseRelationName(tabname,
                               2700                 :            370 :                                        ChooseIndexNameAddition(colnames),
                               2701                 :                :                                        "key",
                               2702                 :                :                                        namespaceId,
                               2703                 :                :                                        true);
                               2704                 :                :     }
                               2705                 :                :     else
                               2706                 :                :     {
                               2707                 :           1296 :         indexname = ChooseRelationName(tabname,
                               2708                 :           1296 :                                        ChooseIndexNameAddition(colnames),
                               2709                 :                :                                        "idx",
                               2710                 :                :                                        namespaceId,
                               2711                 :                :                                        false);
                               2712                 :                :     }
                               2713                 :                : 
                               2714                 :           5624 :     return indexname;
                               2715                 :                : }
                               2716                 :                : 
                               2717                 :                : /*
                               2718                 :                :  * Generate "name2" for a new index given the list of column names for it
                               2719                 :                :  * (as produced by ChooseIndexColumnNames).  This will be passed to
                               2720                 :                :  * ChooseRelationName along with the parent table name and a suitable label.
                               2721                 :                :  *
                               2722                 :                :  * We know that less than NAMEDATALEN characters will actually be used,
                               2723                 :                :  * so we can truncate the result once we've generated that many.
                               2724                 :                :  *
                               2725                 :                :  * XXX See also ChooseForeignKeyConstraintNameAddition and
                               2726                 :                :  * ChooseExtendedStatisticNameAddition.
                               2727                 :                :  */
                               2728                 :                : static char *
  734 peter@eisentraut.org     2729                 :           1769 : ChooseIndexNameAddition(const List *colnames)

                               2731                 :                :     char        buf[NAMEDATALEN * 2];

                               2734                 :                : 
                               2735                 :           1769 :     buf[0] = '\0';
                               2736   [ +  -  +  +  :           4073 :     foreach(lc, colnames)

                               2739                 :                : 
                               2740         [ +  + ]:           2304 :         if (buflen > 0)
 5660 bruce@momjian.us         2741                 :            535 :             buf[buflen++] = '_';    /* insert _ between names */
                               2742                 :                : 
                               2743                 :                :         /*
                               2744                 :                :          * At this point we have buflen <= NAMEDATALEN.  name should be less

                               2746                 :                :          */

                               2753                 :                : }
                               2754                 :                : 
                               2755                 :                : /*
                               2756                 :                :  * Select the actual names to be used for the columns of an index, given the

                               2758                 :                :  * names are unique so we don't get a conflicting-attribute-names error.
                               2759                 :                :  *

                               2914                 :                : /*
                               2915                 :                :  * ReindexIndex
                               2916                 :                :  *      Recreate a specific index.
                               2917                 :                :  */
                               2918                 :                : static void
  631                          2919                 :            192 : ReindexIndex(const ReindexStmt *stmt, const ReindexParams *params, bool isTopLevel)
                               2920                 :                : {
                               2921                 :            192 :     const RangeVar *indexRelation = stmt->relation;
                               2922                 :                :     struct ReindexIndexCallbackState state;
                               2923                 :                :     Oid         indOid;
                               2924                 :                :     char        persistence;
                               2925                 :                :     char        relkind;
                               2926                 :                : 
                               2927                 :                :     /*
                               2928                 :                :      * Find and lock index, and check permissions on table; use callback to
                               2929                 :                :      * obtain lock on table first, to avoid deadlock hazard.  The lock level
                               2930                 :                :      * used here must match the index lock obtained in reindex_index().
                               2931                 :                :      *
                               2932                 :                :      * If it's a temporary index, we will perform a non-concurrent reindex,
                               2933                 :                :      * even if CONCURRENTLY was requested.  In that case, reindex_index() will
                               2934                 :                :      * upgrade the lock, but that's OK, because other sessions can't hold
                               2935                 :                :      * locks on our temporary table.
                               2936                 :                :      */
 1681                          2937                 :            192 :     state.params = *params;
 2302 peter@eisentraut.org     2938                 :            192 :     state.locked_table_oid = InvalidOid;
 2342                          2939                 :            192 :     indOid = RangeVarGetRelidExtended(indexRelation,
 1681 michael@paquier.xyz      2940         [ +  + ]:            192 :                                       (params->options & REINDEXOPT_CONCURRENTLY) != 0 ?
                               2941                 :                :                                       ShareUpdateExclusiveLock : AccessExclusiveLock,
                               2942                 :                :                                       0,
                               2943                 :                :                                       RangeVarCallbackForReindexIndex,
                               2944                 :                :                                       &state);
                               2945                 :                : 
                               2946                 :                :     /*
                               2947                 :                :      * Obtain the current persistence and kind of the existing index.  We
                               2948                 :                :      * already hold a lock on the index.
                               2949                 :                :      */

 1681                          2955   [ +  +  +  + ]:            150 :     else if ((params->options & REINDEXOPT_CONCURRENTLY) != 0 &&

                               2958                 :                :     else
                               2959                 :                :     {

                               2961                 :                : 
                               2962                 :             65 :         newparams.options |= REINDEXOPT_REPORT_PROGRESS;

                               2964                 :                :     }
 5018 rhaas@postgresql.org     2965                 :            139 : }
                               2966                 :                : 
                               2967                 :                : /*
                               2968                 :                :  * Check permissions on table before acquiring relation lock; also lock
                               2969                 :                :  * the heap before the RangeVarGetRelidExtended takes the index lock, to avoid
                               2970                 :                :  * deadlocks.
                               2971                 :                :  */
                               2972                 :                : static void
                               2973                 :            197 : RangeVarCallbackForReindexIndex(const RangeVar *relation,
                               2974                 :                :                                 Oid relId, Oid oldRelId, void *arg)
                               2975                 :                : {
                               2976                 :                :     char        relkind;
 2302 peter@eisentraut.org     2977                 :            197 :     struct ReindexIndexCallbackState *state = arg;
                               2978                 :                :     LOCKMODE    table_lockmode;
                               2979                 :                :     Oid         table_oid;
                               2980                 :                : 
                               2981                 :                :     /*
                               2982                 :                :      * Lock level here should match table lock in reindex_index() for
                               2983                 :                :      * non-concurrent case and table locks used by index_concurrently_*() for
                               2984                 :                :      * concurrent case.
                               2985                 :                :      */
 1681 michael@paquier.xyz      2986                 :            394 :     table_lockmode = (state->params.options & REINDEXOPT_CONCURRENTLY) != 0 ?
 1817                          2987         [ +  + ]:            197 :         ShareUpdateExclusiveLock : ShareLock;
                               2988                 :                : 
                               2989                 :                :     /*
                               2990                 :                :      * If we previously locked some other index's heap, and the name we're
                               2991                 :                :      * looking up no longer refers to that relation, release the now-useless
                               2992                 :                :      * lock.
                               2993                 :                :      */

                               3060                 :                :      * will upgrade the lock, but that's OK, because other sessions can't hold

                               3099                 :                : /*
                               3100                 :                :  * ReindexMultipleTables
                               3101                 :                :  *      Recreate indexes of tables selected by objectName/objectKind.
                               3102                 :                :  *
                               3103                 :                :  * To reduce the probability of deadlocks, each table is reindexed in a
                               3104                 :                :  * separate transaction, so we can release the lock on it right away.

                               3364                 :                :      * provide more context under which a problem happens.

 1813 michael@paquier.xyz      3540                 :            110 :     StartTransactionCommand();
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     3541                 :            110 : }
                               3542                 :                : 
                               3543                 :                : 
                               3544                 :                : /*
                               3545                 :                :  * ReindexRelationConcurrently - process REINDEX CONCURRENTLY for given
                               3546                 :                :  * relation OID
                               3547                 :                :  *
                               3548                 :                :  * 'relationOid' can either belong to an index, a table or a materialized
                               3549                 :                :  * view.  For tables and materialized views, all its indexes will be rebuilt,
                               3550                 :                :  * excluding invalid indexes and any indexes used in exclusion constraints,
                               3551                 :                :  * but including its associated toast table indexes.  For indexes, the index
                               3552                 :                :  * itself will be rebuilt.
                               3553                 :                :  *
                               3554                 :                :  * The locks taken on parent tables and involved indexes are kept until the
                               3555                 :                :  * transaction is committed, at which point a session lock is taken on each
                               3556                 :                :  * relation.  Both of these protect against concurrent schema changes.
                               3557                 :                :  *
                               3558                 :                :  * Returns true if any indexes have been rebuilt (including toast table's
                               3559                 :                :  * indexes, when relevant), otherwise returns false.
                               3560                 :                :  *
                               3561                 :                :  * NOTE: This cannot be used on temporary relations.  A concurrent build would
                               3562                 :                :  * cause issues with ON COMMIT actions triggered by the transactions of the
                               3563                 :                :  * concurrent build.  Temporary relations are not subject to concurrent
                               3564                 :                :  * concerns, so there's no need for the more complicated concurrent build,
                               3565                 :                :  * anyway, and a non-concurrent reindex is more efficient.
                               3566                 :                :  */
                               3567                 :                : static bool
  631 michael@paquier.xyz      3568                 :            263 : ReindexRelationConcurrently(const ReindexStmt *stmt, Oid relationOid, const ReindexParams *params)
                               3569                 :                : {
                               3570                 :                :     typedef struct ReindexIndexInfo
                               3571                 :                :     {
                               3572                 :                :         Oid         indexId;
                               3573                 :                :         Oid         tableId;
                               3574                 :                :         Oid         amId;
                               3575                 :                :         bool        safe;       /* for set_indexsafe_procflags */
                               3576                 :                :     } ReindexIndexInfo;
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     3577                 :            263 :     List       *heapRelationIds = NIL;
                               3578                 :            263 :     List       *indexIds = NIL;
                               3579                 :            263 :     List       *newIndexIds = NIL;
                               3580                 :            263 :     List       *relationLocks = NIL;
                               3581                 :            263 :     List       *lockTags = NIL;
                               3582                 :                :     ListCell   *lc,
                               3583                 :                :                *lc2;
                               3584                 :                :     MemoryContext private_context;
                               3585                 :                :     MemoryContext oldcontext;
                               3586                 :                :     char        relkind;
                               3587                 :            263 :     char       *relationName = NULL;
                               3588                 :            263 :     char       *relationNamespace = NULL;
                               3589                 :                :     PGRUsage    ru0;
 1792 michael@paquier.xyz      3590                 :            263 :     const int   progress_index[] = {
                               3591                 :                :         PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_COMMAND,
                               3592                 :                :         PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_PHASE,
                               3593                 :                :         PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_INDEX_OID,
                               3594                 :                :         PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_ACCESS_METHOD_OID
                               3595                 :                :     };
                               3596                 :                :     int64       progress_vals[4];
                               3597                 :                : 
                               3598                 :                :     /*
                               3599                 :                :      * Create a memory context that will survive forced transaction commits we
                               3600                 :                :      * do below.  Since it is a child of PortalContext, it will go away
                               3601                 :                :      * eventually even if we suffer an error; there's no need for special
                               3602                 :                :      * abort cleanup logic.
                               3603                 :                :      */
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     3604                 :            263 :     private_context = AllocSetContextCreate(PortalContext,
                               3605                 :                :                                             "ReindexConcurrent",
                               3606                 :                :                                             ALLOCSET_SMALL_SIZES);
                               3607                 :                : 
 1681 michael@paquier.xyz      3608         [ +  + ]:            263 :     if ((params->options & REINDEXOPT_VERBOSE) != 0)

                               3617                 :                :

                               3619                 :                :     }

                               3850                 :                :      * Definitely no indexes, so leave.  Any checks based on

                               3852                 :                :      * work on is built as the session locks taken before this transaction
                               3853                 :                :      * commits will make sure that they cannot be dropped by a concurrent
                               3854                 :                :      * session until this operation completes.
                               3855                 :                :      */
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     3856         [ +  + ]:CBC         234 :     if (indexIds == NIL)
                               3857                 :             22 :         return false;
                               3858                 :                :

 1664 michael@paquier.xyz      3860         [ +  + ]:            212 :     if (params->tablespaceOid == GLOBALTABLESPACE_OID)
                               3861         [ +  - ]:              3 :         ereport(ERROR,
                               3862                 :                :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
                               3863                 :                :                  errmsg("cannot move non-shared relation to tablespace \"%s\"",
                               3864                 :                :                         get_tablespace_name(params->tablespaceOid))));
                               3865                 :                : 
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     3866         [ -  + ]:            209 :     Assert(heapRelationIds != NIL);
                               3867                 :                : 
                               3868                 :                :     /*-----
                               3869                 :                :      * Now we have all the indexes we want to process in indexIds.
                               3870                 :                :      *
                               3871                 :                :      * The phases now are:
                               3872                 :                :      *
                               3873                 :                :      * 1. create new indexes in the catalog
                               3874                 :                :      * 2. build new indexes
                               3875                 :                :      * 3. let new indexes catch up with tuples inserted in the meantime
                               3876                 :                :      * 4. swap index names
                               3877                 :                :      * 5. mark old indexes as dead
                               3878                 :                :      * 6. drop old indexes
                               3879                 :                :      *
                               3880                 :                :      * We process each phase for all indexes before moving to the next phase,
                               3881                 :                :      * for efficiency.
                               3882                 :                :      */
                               3883                 :                : 
                               3884                 :                :     /*
                               3885                 :                :      * Phase 1 of REINDEX CONCURRENTLY
                               3886                 :                :      *
                               3887                 :                :      * Create a new index with the same properties as the old one, but it is
                               3888                 :                :      * only registered in catalogs and will be built later.  Then get session
                               3889                 :                :      * locks on all involved tables.  See analogous code in DefineIndex() for
                               3890                 :                :      * more detailed comments.
                               3891                 :                :      */
                               3892                 :                : 
                               3893   [ +  -  +  +  :            465 :     foreach(lc, indexIds)
                                              +  + ]

                               4060   [ +  -  +  +  :            968 :     foreach(lc, relationLocks)

                               4061                 :                :     {

 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     4064                 :            762 :         LockRelationIdForSession(lockrelid, ShareUpdateExclusiveLock);

                               4066                 :                : 
                               4067                 :            206 :     PopActiveSnapshot();
                               4068                 :            206 :     CommitTransactionCommand();
                               4069                 :            206 :     StartTransactionCommand();
                               4070                 :                : 
                               4071                 :                :     /*
                               4072                 :                :      * Because we don't take a snapshot in this transaction, there's no need
                               4073                 :                :      * to set the PROC_IN_SAFE_IC flag here.
                               4074                 :                :      */
                               4075                 :                : 
                               4076                 :                :     /*
                               4077                 :                :      * Phase 2 of REINDEX CONCURRENTLY
                               4078                 :                :      *
                               4079                 :                :      * Build the new indexes in a separate transaction for each index to avoid
                               4080                 :                :      * having open transactions for an unnecessary long time.  But before
                               4081                 :                :      * doing that, wait until no running transactions could have the table of
                               4082                 :                :      * the index open with the old list of indexes.  See "phase 2" in
                               4083                 :                :      * DefineIndex() for more details.
                               4084                 :                :      */
                               4085                 :                :

                               4099                 :                :          * Check for user-requested abort.  This is inside a transaction so as

                               4101                 :                :          * session-level locks are cleaned up on abort.

                               4133                 :                :      * Because we don't take a snapshot or Xid in this transaction, there's no

                               4135                 :                :      */
                               4136                 :                :

                               4138                 :                :      * Phase 3 of REINDEX CONCURRENTLY
                               4139                 :                :      *
                               4140                 :                :      * During this phase the old indexes catch up with any new tuples that
                               4141                 :                :      * were created during the previous phase.  See "phase 3" in DefineIndex()
                               4142                 :                :      * for more details.
                               4143                 :                :      */
                               4144                 :                :

                               4146                 :                :                                  PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_PHASE_WAIT_2);

                               4149                 :                :

                               4151                 :                :     {

                               4161                 :                :          * session-level locks are cleaned up on abort.
                               4162                 :                :          */

                               4188                 :                :

                               4192                 :                :          */
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     4193                 :            253 :         limitXmin = snapshot->xmin;

 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     4196                 :            253 :         UnregisterSnapshot(snapshot);
                               4197                 :                : 
                               4198                 :                :         /*
                               4199                 :                :          * To ensure no deadlocks, we must commit and start yet another
                               4200                 :                :          * transaction, and do our wait before any snapshot has been taken in
                               4201                 :                :          * it.
                               4202                 :                :          */
                               4203                 :            253 :         CommitTransactionCommand();
                               4204                 :            253 :         StartTransactionCommand();
                               4205                 :                : 
                               4206                 :                :         /*
                               4207                 :                :          * The index is now valid in the sense that it contains all currently
                               4208                 :                :          * interesting tuples.  But since it might not contain tuples deleted
                               4209                 :                :          * just before the reference snap was taken, we have to wait out any
                               4210                 :                :          * transactions that might have older snapshots.
                               4211                 :                :          *
                               4212                 :                :          * Because we don't take a snapshot or Xid in this transaction,
                               4213                 :                :          * there's no need to set the PROC_IN_SAFE_IC flag here.
                               4214                 :                :          */
 2333                          4215                 :            253 :         pgstat_progress_update_param(PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_PHASE,
                               4216                 :                :                                      PROGRESS_CREATEIDX_PHASE_WAIT_3);
                               4217                 :            253 :         WaitForOlderSnapshots(limitXmin, true);
                               4218                 :                : 
 8140 tgl@sss.pgh.pa.us        4219                 :            253 :         CommitTransactionCommand();
                               4220                 :                :     }
                               4221                 :                : 
                               4222                 :                :     /*
                               4223                 :                :      * Phase 4 of REINDEX CONCURRENTLY
                               4224                 :                :      *
                               4225                 :                :      * Now that the new indexes have been validated, swap each new index with
                               4226                 :                :      * its corresponding old index.
                               4227                 :                :      *
                               4228                 :                :      * We mark the new indexes as valid and the old indexes as not valid at
                               4229                 :                :      * the same time to make sure we only get constraint violations from the
                               4230                 :                :      * indexes with the correct names.
                               4231                 :                :      */
                               4232                 :                : 
                               4233                 :            203 :     StartTransactionCommand();
                               4234                 :                : 
                               4235                 :                :     /*
                               4236                 :                :      * Because this transaction only does catalog manipulations and doesn't do
                               4237                 :                :      * any index operations, we can set the PROC_IN_SAFE_IC flag here
                               4238                 :                :      * unconditionally.
                               4239                 :                :      */
 1684 alvherre@alvh.no-ip.     4240                 :            203 :     set_indexsafe_procflags();
                               4241                 :                : 
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     4242   [ +  -  +  +  :            456 :     forboth(lc, indexIds, lc2, newIndexIds)
                                     +  -  +  +  +  
                                        +  +  -  +  
                                                 + ]
                               4243                 :                :     {
 1687 alvherre@alvh.no-ip.     4244                 :            253 :         ReindexIndexInfo *oldidx = lfirst(lc);
                               4245                 :            253 :         ReindexIndexInfo *newidx = lfirst(lc2);

                               4249                 :                :          * Check for user-requested abort.  This is inside a transaction so as

                               4251                 :                :          * session-level locks are cleaned up on abort.
                               4252                 :                :          */

                               4255                 :                :         /* Choose a relation name for old index */

                               4260                 :                :                                      false);
                               4261                 :                :

                               4263                 :                :          * Swapping the indexes might involve TOAST table access, so ensure we
                               4264                 :                :          * have a valid snapshot.
                               4265                 :                :          */
  334 nathan@postgresql.or     4266                 :            253 :         PushActiveSnapshot(GetTransactionSnapshot());
                               4267                 :                :

                               4269                 :                :          * Swap old index with the new one.  This also marks the new one as
                               4270                 :                :          * valid and the old one as not valid.
                               4271                 :                :          */
 1687 alvherre@alvh.no-ip.     4272                 :            253 :         index_concurrently_swap(newidx->indexId, oldidx->indexId, oldName);

  334 nathan@postgresql.or     4274                 :            253 :         PopActiveSnapshot();
                               4275                 :                : 
                               4276                 :                :         /*
                               4277                 :                :          * Invalidate the relcache for the table, so that after this commit
                               4278                 :                :          * all sessions will refresh any cached plans that might reference the
                               4279                 :                :          * index.
                               4280                 :                :          */
 1687 alvherre@alvh.no-ip.     4281                 :            253 :         CacheInvalidateRelcacheByRelid(oldidx->tableId);
                               4282                 :                : 
                               4283                 :                :         /*
                               4284                 :                :          * CCI here so that subsequent iterations see the oldName in the
                               4285                 :                :          * catalog and can choose a nonconflicting name for their oldName.
                               4286                 :                :          * Otherwise, this could lead to conflicts if a table has two indexes
                               4287                 :                :          * whose names are equal for the first NAMEDATALEN-minus-a-few
                               4288                 :                :          * characters.
                               4289                 :                :          */
 2342 peter@eisentraut.org     4290                 :            253 :         CommandCounterIncrement();
                               4291                 :                :     }
                               4292                 :                : 
                               4293                 :                :     /* Commit this transaction and make index swaps visible */
                               4294                 :            203 :     CommitTransactionCommand();
                               4295                 :            203 :     StartTransactionCommand();
                               4296                 :                : 
                               4297                 :                :     /*
                               4298                 :                :      * While we could set PROC_IN_SAFE_IC if all indexes qualified, there's no
                               4299                 :                :      * real need for that, because we only acquire an Xid after the wait is
                               4300                 :                :      * done, and that lasts for a very short period.
                               4301                 :                :      */
                               4302                 :                : 
                               4303                 :                :     /*
                               4304                 :                :      * Phase 5 of REINDEX CONCURRENTLY
                               4305                 :                :      *
                               4306                 :                :      * Mark the old indexes as dead.  First we must wait until no running
                               4307                 :                :      * transaction could be using the index for a query.  See also

                               4309                 :                :      */

                               4314                 :                :

                               4320                 :                :          * Check for user-requested abort.  This is inside a transaction so as

                               4348                 :                :      * Phase 6 of REINDEX CONCURRENTLY

 2315                          4575                 :            379 : update_relispartition(Oid relationId, bool newval)

  336 noah@leadboat.com        4585                 :CBC         379 :     otid = tup->t_self;

 2315 alvherre@alvh.no-ip.     4590                 :            379 :     heap_freetuple(tup);
                               4591                 :            379 :     table_close(classRel, RowExclusiveLock);
                               4592                 :            379 : }
                               4593                 :                : 
                               4594                 :                : /*
                               4595                 :                :  * Set the PROC_IN_SAFE_IC flag in MyProc->statusFlags.
                               4596                 :                :  *
                               4597                 :                :  * When doing concurrent index builds, we can set this flag
                               4598                 :                :  * to tell other processes concurrently running CREATE
                               4599                 :                :  * INDEX CONCURRENTLY or REINDEX CONCURRENTLY to ignore us when
                               4600                 :                :  * doing their waits for concurrent snapshots.  On one hand it
                               4601                 :                :  * avoids pointlessly waiting for a process that's not interesting
                               4602                 :                :  * anyway; but more importantly it avoids deadlocks in some cases.
                               4603                 :                :  *
                               4604                 :                :  * This can be done safely only for indexes that don't execute any
                               4605                 :                :  * expressions that could access other tables, so index must not be
                               4606                 :                :  * expressional nor partial.  Caller is responsible for only calling
                               4607                 :                :  * this routine when that assumption holds true.
                               4608                 :                :  *
                               4609                 :                :  * (The flag is reset automatically at transaction end, so it must be
                               4610                 :                :  * set for each transaction.)
                               4611                 :                :  */
                               4612                 :                : static inline void
 1735                          4613                 :            835 : set_indexsafe_procflags(void)
                               4614                 :                : {
                               4615                 :                :     /*
                               4616                 :                :      * This should only be called before installing xid or xmin in MyProc;
                               4617                 :                :      * otherwise, concurrent processes could see an Xmin that moves backwards.
                               4618                 :                :      */
                               4619   [ +  -  -  + ]:            835 :     Assert(MyProc->xid == InvalidTransactionId &&
                               4620                 :                :            MyProc->xmin == InvalidTransactionId);
                               4621                 :                : 
                               4622                 :            835 :     LWLockAcquire(ProcArrayLock, LW_EXCLUSIVE);
                               4623                 :            835 :     MyProc->statusFlags |= PROC_IN_SAFE_IC;
                               4624                 :            835 :     ProcGlobal->statusFlags[MyProc->pgxactoff] = MyProc->statusFlags;
                               4625                 :            835 :     LWLockRelease(ProcArrayLock);
                               4626                 :            835 : }
